entry.title: Ripple Vs. SEC Court Update: Why A Ruling Can Take Even Longer
entry.summary:
In the legal battle between Ripple and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), anticipation has reached fever pitch as the community eagerly awaits a ruling. Already 931 days ago, the SEC filed its lawsuit against Ripple Labs and its executives Brad Garlinghouse and Chris Larsen. The last publicly visible action in the litigation occurred on June 13, when the Hinman documents were released. Since then there has been silence.
Why A Ruling Can Take Even Longer
Attorney John E Deaton, representing 75,000 XRP holders as amicus curiae, recently took to Twitter to shed light on the prolonged timeline and dispel speculations surrounding the case. Deaton‚Äôs enlightening Twitter thread reveals an interesting aspect of the Ripple vs. SEC case: the surprisingly long duration it has take‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ethereum Node Locations Raise Concerns About US Government Involvement
entry.summary:
Ethereum is currently the largest proof of stake (P0S) network after transitioning from a proof of work (PoW) mechanism late last year. This means that the network now uses validators to carry out transactions as opposed to miners using energy-intensive computers to solve complex mathematical problems to do the same thing ‚Äì something that has been applauded as a step in the right direction by many in the space.
However, the location of Ethereum nodes worldwide, particularly their concentration in a particular location, has raised concerns among participants after a Twitter user pointed out a disturbing fact.
More Than 50% Of Ethereum Nodes Are In The United States
On Sunday, a Twitter user that goes by Hamzah Khan made a post revealing that over 50% of Ethereum‚Äôs nodes are being host‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Exchange Whale Ratio At Lowest Since 2018, Here‚Äôs What It Means
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows that the Bitcoin exchange whale ratio has declined to the lowest value since 2018. Here‚Äôs what this may mean for the asset.
Bitcoin Exchange Whale Ratio (14-Day SMA) Has Plunged Recently
As an analyst in a CryptoQuant post pointed out, whale activity on exchanges has been dropping recently. The ‚Äúexchange whale ratio‚Äù is an indicator that measures the ratio between the sum of the top ten Bitcoin transactions going to exchanges and the total exchange inflows.
Generally, the ten largest transfers heading towards exchanges are coming from the whales, so this ratio can tell us how the inflow from the whales compares with that of the entire market right now.
When the value of this metric is high, it means that these humongous investors are making up a large part of th‚Ä¶

entry.title: Serial Scammer And Rug Puller Steals Over $315,000 From Fake Meme Coins
entry.summary:
A serial scammer and rug-puller have amassed over 160 ETH, worth $315,000 at spot rates, by creating fraudulent meme coins and rugging users off their hard-earned funds, on-chain data analyzed by LookonChain on July 9 shows.
Records show that the scammer‚Äôs scheme involves creating meme tokens and adding liquidity on Uniswap‚Äìa popular decentralized exchange‚Äìto entice unsuspecting liquidity providers and buyers, only to withdraw all the liquidity from the pool several days later, forcing prices to plunge. His actions have resulted in the loss of over 160 ETH over the last few weeks.
Fraudulent Meme Coins And Rug Pulls

PepeCoin (PEPE) emerged in April 2023 as a meme coin, distinct from the more prevalent dog-themed meme coins like Shiba Inu and Dogecoin. entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponents‚Äîand you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.

entry.title: "AI Is Game-Changing But Needs Fact-Checking": AlchemyAI Project Lead
entry.summary: In this interview, Decrypt's Jason Nelson chats with Alchemy product manager and AlchemyAI project lead Elan Halpern on blockchain analysis using ChatGPT, what AI means for better user experience, and the need to fact-check AI. Halpern also gives a demo of the new AlchemyAI ChatGPT plugin.

entry.title: Fractal Is Like an Arcade, Says Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan
entry.summary: Justin Kan was a co-founder of Twitch and now works on Fractal, a Web3 gaming startup. Kan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his new company and what he's up to.

entry.title: Are NFTs the Next SEC Target?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin discusses the current regulatory climate in the U.S. with Gala Games' President of Blockchain Jason Brink.
